snippet: Government critics called a leaked video of two journalists being arrested in a Cairo hotel room in December an attempt to intimidate opponents of the military-backed government.
abstract: Leaked video of the arrest of journalists Mohamed Fahmy and Peter Greste offers a close-up view of the Egyptian military-backed government's crackdown on dissent; video is the latest salvo in a propaganda campaign by the state-run and pro-military news media, and the goal is to paint the journalists as part of a terrorist conspiracy.
lead_paragraph: Government critics called a leaked video of two journalists being arrested in a Cairo hotel room in December an attempt to intimidate opponents of the military-backed government.

headline.main: Video of Journalists’ Arrest in Egypt Seen as Threat to Media
headline.print_headline: Video Shows Egypt Police Arresting 2 Journalists

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
